radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated up to 11 mm in thickness, with mural hyperemia and surrounding fat stranding. The liver enhances homogeneously with curvilinear calcifications likely outlining a hemangioma. The gallbladder and biliary tree appear normal. The pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands appear normal. The kidneys enhance normally. There are several parapelvic cysts on the left. No ascites, fluid collection, or pneumoperitoneum are present. The rectum and urinary bladder are normal, with no pelvic free fluid or mass.
